sentence.Network_en: I was standing next to the forsythia is still looking at.
sentence.Network_cn: 我站在旁边仍然在望着连翘.

sentence.Network_en: Perennials like the azalea and forsythia bloom year after year.
sentence.Network_cn: 多年生的植物如杜鹃、连翘一年接一年地开花.

sentence.Network_en: The inevitable forsythia, but it's him who trumpet forth the spring.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些不可避免连翘, 但是是他谁喇叭向前那些春天.

derivation.yuyuan_name: modern Latin, named after William Forsyth (1737–1804), Scottish botanist and horticulturalist, said to have introduced the shrub into Britain from China

entry.def: Forsythia is a bush whose yellow flowers appear in the spring before the leaves have grown.

means.word_mean: 1. any of various early blooming oleaceous shrubs of the genus Forsythia; native to eastern Asia and southern Europe but widely cultivated for their branches of bright yellow bell-shaped flowers

auth_sentence.content: The blooms are followed by unusual pleated leaves that are vastly more interesting that the bland ones of forsythia.
auth_sentence.res_content: The blooms are followed by unusual pleated leaves that are vastly more interesting that the bland ones of forsythia.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The blooms are followed by unusual pleated leaves that are vastly more interesting that the bland ones of forsythia.

auth_sentence.content: While they aren't as bright yellow as forsythia flowers, they make up for that in their odd drooping configuration.
